page.title: 04St.John's Ambulance Brigade
page.content: St.John's Ambulance Brigade meet in Albert Lane on a Thursday evening at 6.00. I am a junior but when I am 11 I shall be a cadet if I pass certain tests. The meeting lasts for one and a half hours. First of all we 'fall in', stand to attention and at ease. After that we pay our subs which are 5p a week. Then we 'fall out'. The juniors and cadets split into two groups. Mr Maycock our divisional superintendent talks to us about first aid. We have learnt bandaging, how to treat burns, and artificial respiration - we practice this on a plastic doll called Annie. Every year we go to camp and this year the cadets went to Germany. After cadets we join the adults brigade and can help give first aid at football matches and other local events like the Venetian Fete.
